topics.body:
. . . Well I just accidentally made myself feel like shit tonight through video games.

If you're wondering how it's cause of Fallout 3; if you choose to save Megaton City your dad when at the water treatment experiment will say that he's proud of you and say that you're a good person.  The reason why this made me feel like shit is that I've never been told this by anyone, except for whenever they utterly fuck up as a person and do something horrible and they tell me this as a cheap way of getting out of feeling bad about themselves as a person.  I have never been told that I'm a good person or that anyone's proud of me by someone that hasn't hurt me emotionally offline; all of the times I've been told this is that it's been by someone that was screaming profanities, calling me a "faggot" or insulting me in some way and them realizing that they've done something horrible so they try to get out of feeling horrible about how they've acted by going "you're a good person".

I try to be a good person, but all my family sees is that I don't have kids already and the one's that know all they see is "oh uc9 is bi that means I'm not getting grandkids"/"uc9 is trans that means I'm not getting grandkids"/"uc9 wants to wait to start a family cause he's had a couple shit relationships so he's waiting to find someone he actually loves so I'm not getting grandkids right this second"/"Oh well you can't ever be a good person cause it's never good enough"/"you can't be a good person cause even though you're paying your rent because you don't have a car/higher paying job/my own house/<insert scapegoat reason to paint me as a bad person> that means he's a bad person".

I try to be a good person; even though our family has a extreme biological impulse to hurt others I resist that thought in the back of my mind that says it's okay to harm others and legitimately care about people.  No matter what I do I can never be in anyone's eyes a good person simply because I'm bi/trans/don't have kids/don't have a car/don't have a house/ -don't have a job- (this one is scratched off the list because I have a job now).  The way the people around me quantify what a good person is someone that's straight, has kids, has a car and has a house and people wonder why I struggle with mental problems because if that is what is quantified as a "good" person then I can never be good no matter what I do.

Tl:dr; my family quantifies what defines a good person as someone that's straight, has kids, has a house, has a job, has a car and because I'm not straight I can never be a good person to them.

!http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/167/100/tumblr_loal57yTbj1qbnd1c.gif!
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54d7f3066368722891340700#post_54d7f3066368722891340700

[spoiler]You shouldn't think lowly of yourself just because others do. They don't really have control over you; you're your own man. You can either shape up to their standards or continue with your own way of life. Just don't let their view of things get into your head. You're a great person.[/spoiler]

ugh im not helpful at times but here

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54d7f3066368722891340700#post_54d7f3066368722891340700
I hate to basically repeat what Marc and Carcass, but yeah, fuck what your family thinks of you. You are you're own person and NOBODY can tell you otherwise.
And while I'm not sure it'll mean much since I'm an online user whom you've never met, but _*I think you're a goddamn treat to be around.*_

If you ever need to talk, send a message. I might not reply right away but you can bet I will eventually.

I'm okayish; I just now know why their constant attempts at being social drive me crazy.  If you knew someone that constantly made you feel like shit as a human being wouldn't you be annoyed if they constantly went "why don't you want to talk to me?  Why aren't you more social?"  I am social, just not to these pricks.
